explanation: The stage direction describes the setting of the play, specifically referencing the Palace of the Ocean and Thétis, as well as the accompanying rivers and fountains. This fits the definition of 'setting' as it provides a description of the location in which the action takes place.
stgdir: Le théâtre représente le Palais de l'Ocean, et de Thétis, qui y sont accompagnez des Fleuves, des Rivières, des Fontaines, des Ruisseaux, etc.
